primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformation of individuals (Romero, Gomez, the congregation) into witnesses of truth through the encounter with the poor and the reception of the Spirit's power.

tekstueel_bewijs: Wir können uns an andere erinnern.
Wir brauchen uns nicht zu fürchten.
Er [Romero] organisiert uns, will sagen, er bekehrt uns.
von den Armen evangelisiert worden ist
bis in die entferntesten Länder der Erde
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject (the one who must become a witness).

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit/The Example of Saints
tekstueel_bewijs: Ihr werdet die Kraft des heiligen Geistes empfangen.
Was wir an Oscar Romero lernen können.
helper.rol_van_god: God (as Spirit) is instrumentalized as a source of 'power' (Helper) for the human Subject.
helper.rol_van_geest: External endowment of 'Mut' (courage) and 'Wahrheitsfähigkeit' (capacity for truth).

tekstueel_bewijs: die die Realität nicht wahrhaben wollen
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily the socio-political status quo and the internal 'stupid opinion' that we cannot be like saints.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Conversion of the Saint' (Romero's own journey from ignorance to witness).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Oscar Romero
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Romero's story serves as the 'competence-building' phase for the hearer's own narrative.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Poor/The Dead → Justice/Truth → The World
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit/Romero → The Hearer ← Fear/Social Injustice

voorbeelden_god_subject: Ihr werdet die Kraft des heiligen Geistes empfangen.
Gottes Gebot sagt: Du sollst nicht töten.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Wir können uns an andere erinnern.

voorbeelden: Er [Romero] will sagen, er bekehrt uns.
Wir brauchen uns nicht zu fürchten.
Das können wir an Oscar Romero lernen.
Irgendwann einmal wird es auch der Vatikan merken.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on 'Empowerment'. It assumes the hearer has the 'Devoir' (obligation) but needs the 'Savoir' (example of Romero) and 'Pouvoir' (Spirit as fuel) to act.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Death) to ~S2 (The dead are not dead) to S1 (Witnessing).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Organization' of the cause of justice which survives death.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; death is seen as a transition to a more 'active' influence rather than a final enemy defeated by God.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using the language of the Spirit, the sermon is structurally anthropocentric. The 'engine' is the human imitation of a heroic model (Romero) to achieve social justice. God is the 'Helper' (power-source) rather than the 'Subject' of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Wie Oscar Romero, so auch wir. Wie Jesus, so auch wir.
Was ist die Kraft des Geistes? Mut und Wahrheitsfähigkeit.

exemplarism_check.beschrijving: Romero is presented as a fallible but ultimately successful model of conversion and courage that the hearer can and should replicate.
exemplarism_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the one who, despite Romero's mistakes and the power of death, vindicates the weak and establishes His kingdom.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Inspiration followed by potential exhaustion (the burden of being a 'witness' like a martyr).
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is collapsed into Ethics; being 'saved' is equated with being 'converted to the cause of the poor'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is coherent as a call to political/social action, but the theological 'Primary Program' (God's action) is almost entirely absorbed by the 'Secondary Program' (Human response).
spanning_punten: The quote 'Wie Jesus, so auch wir' flattens the ontological difference between the Redeemer and the redeemed.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Er [Romero] organisiert uns, will sagen, er bekehrt uns.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (courage) for the human Subject to perform the task.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'not wanting to see reality' or 'stupid opinions' rather than a cosmic bondage.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: Man (The 'Volk' who canonizes Romero and carries on the cause).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a recruitment speech for social activism. God is the battery, Romero is the blueprint, and the Hearer is the builder.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the Subject of 'witnessing' and 'truth-telling'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject who witnesses to the Father through the church.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We will be witnesses,' use 'Christ will make His truth known through our weakness.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the hearer is first the one 'evangelized' by God's grace before they can act.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Focus on Devoir (the divine mandate) as a gift of Grace.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explore why we *cannot* be witnesses on our own, necessitating a Subject-switch to Christ.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the 'Opponent' as the power of Death that only a Resurrection (not just 'not being dead') can overcome.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a heavy opponent, the 'power of the Spirit' becomes a mere psychological boost.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God's victory over death (Soteriology) -> 2. Our participation in His truth (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The passion for justice is commendable, but ensure the 'Good News' is what God has done in Christ, not just what we can do with the Spirit's help.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is powerful and uses evocative imagery (Romero). Actantially, it reveals a shift where the human becomes the primary actor.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Acts 1:8 usually emphasizes the sovereign initiative of the ascended Lord; here, it is used as a mandate for human 'Wahrheitsfähigkeit'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'Jesus' and 'The Spirit' are functioning as Adjuvants (Helpers) rather than Subjects, exposing the underlying moralism.

volledige_subject_lijst: Wir (erinnern, werden Zeugen sein, brauchen uns nicht zu fürchten)
appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Liberation Theology' moralism where the Gospel is the 'cause' of the poor.
